herbalPlants.description: Adusa, also known as Malabar Nut, is used in treating cough, asthma, and bronchitis. It is a herb that grows in tropical regions and prefers full sun exposure.
Pineapple is a tropical fruit known for its high vitamin C content. It helps in treating sore throat, diabetes, heart disease, and obesity.
Ashwagandha is a powerful adaptogen known for its stress-relieving and energy-boosting properties. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soil under full sun.
Neem is a versatile medicinal plant known for its antibacterial, antifungal, and anti-inflammatory properties. It is widely used in skincare and for boosting immunity.
Brahmi is an herb known for enhancing memory, cognitive function, and reducing anxiety. It grows well in damp, marshy conditions with partial shade.
Giloy is a well-known herb in Ayurveda for boosting immunity and treating chronic fevers and diabetes. It prefers moderate watering and full sunlight.
Tulsi, also known as Holy Basil, is a sacred plant in India known for its medicinal properties, especially in treating respiratory issues and boosting immunity.
Aloe Vera is a succulent plant known for its healing properties, particularly in skincare and digestive health. It grows best in well-drained, sandy soil with full sun.
Arjuna is a tree known for its strong heart-protective properties, often used in traditional medicine to manage blood pressure and cholesterol levels.
Fenugreek is an herb widely used in cooking and traditional medicine for its digestive and blood sugar-lowering benefits.
Shatavari is a rejuvenating herb in Ayurveda, known for supporting women's health, boosting immunity, and promoting digestion.
Gudmar is a climbing plant known for its anti-diabetic properties and its ability to reduce sugar cravings. It grows well in tropical climates with full sun.
Jatamansi is an herb known for its calming effects, promoting restful sleep, and supporting hair health. It thrives in cooler, mountainous regions.
Guggul is a resin obtained from the Indian Bdellium tree, used in Ayurvedic medicine to treat high cholesterol, arthritis, and skin disorders.
Amla is a powerful antioxidant-rich fruit that supports immunity, aids digestion, and enhances skin health. It grows best in well-drained soil with full sun.
Bhumi Amla is a small herb used in traditional medicine for its liver-protective and kidney stone-reducing properties.
Neem is valued for its skin care, antiseptic, and dental health benefits. It thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Guggul is known for its benefits in joint health, cholesterol management, and anti-inflammatory effects. It grows best in dry, well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Methi, or Fenugreek, is used for its digestive health benefits, blood sugar regulation, and lactation support. It grows well in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Tulsi, or Holy Basil, is renowned for boosting immunity, relieving stress, and supporting respiratory health. It grows well in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Ashwagandha, or Withania, is used for stress relief, boosting energy, and cognitive health. It thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Yarrow is known for its wound healing, digestive health, and anti-inflammatory properties. It grows well in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Ginger is valued for its digestive health benefits, anti-nausea properties, and anti-inflammatory effects. It grows best in warm, well-drained soil with partial shade.
Turmeric is known for its anti-inflammatory, digestive health, and skin care benefits. It thrives in warm, well-drained soil with partial shade.
Kalmegh is a bitter herb known for its potent antiviral and liver-protective properties, commonly used in treating fever and boosting immunity.
Haritaki is a revered herb in Ayurveda for its detoxifying and digestive benefits. It is often used in various herbal formulations for its health-enhancing properties.
The Arjuna tree is renowned in Ayurvedic medicine for its heart-strengthening and blood pressure-lowering properties. It grows well in loamy soil with full sun.
Chirata is a bitter herb known for its powerful antipyretic and digestive properties, often used in treating fever and digestive disorders.
Neem is a versatile tree known for its medicinal properties. It is widely used in traditional medicine for skin disorders, boosting immunity, and as a natural insect repellent.
Tulsi is a sacred herb in Indian culture, revered for its ability to promote respiratory health, boost immunity, and relieve stress. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
Ashwagandha is a powerful adaptogenic herb known for its ability to reduce stress, boost energy, and enhance immunity. It grows best in loamy soil with full sun.
Gokhru is a herb known for its benefits in supporting kidney health, enhancing libido, and improving muscle strength. It grows in sandy soil with full sun exposure.
Manjistha is a well-known herb in Ayurveda for its powerful blood-purifying and detoxifying properties. It is commonly used to promote clear and healthy skin.
Giloy is a highly revered herb in Ayurveda, known for its immune-boosting, fever-reducing, and detoxifying properties. It grows as a climber and thrives in loamy soil.
Brahmi is a traditional herb known for its brain-boosting properties, enhancing memory, reducing stress, and promoting overall brain health. It grows well in wet, marshy areas.
Nagarmotha is a herb known for its digestive and weight loss benefits, as well as its use in enhancing skin health. It thrives in sandy soil with full sun exposure.
Mulethi, or Licorice, is a popular herb known for its soothing effects on the respiratory system, aiding in digestion, and boosting immunity. It prefers loamy soil with partial shade.
Kalmegh is a potent herb used in traditional medicine for liver health, boosting immunity, and detoxification. It grows well in loamy soil with partial shade.
Shatavari is an adaptogenic herb known for supporting women's health, boosting immunity, and aiding digestion. It prefers sandy loam soil with partial shade.
Ajwain is a well-known spice and herb used for its digestive benefits, promoting respiratory health, and boosting immunity. It thrives in loamy soil with full sun exposure.
Moringa, also known as the drumstick tree, is valued for its high nutritional content, ability to boost immunity, and energy-boosting properties. It grows well in sandy loam soil with full sun.
Arjuna is a medicinal tree known for its benefits in supporting heart health, regulating blood pressure, and improving liver function. It thrives in sandy loam soil with full sun.
Jatamansi is an aromatic herb used for its calming effects, stress relief, and as a sleep aid. It grows in loamy soil with partial shade and requires regular watering.
Rakta Chandana, or Red Sandalwood, is a valuable tree used for its skin care benefits, anti-inflammatory properties, and blood purification. It prefers loamy soil and full sun exposure.
Guggul is a resinous herb used in Ayurveda for managing cholesterol, aiding weight loss, and providing relief from arthritis. It grows well in sandy soil with full sun.
Kapur Kachri, also known as Spiked Ginger Lily, is an aromatic herb used for its respiratory health benefits, in aromatherapy, and as a digestive aid. It thrives in loamy soil with partial shade.
Bhumi Amla is a small herb known for its benefits in supporting liver health, kidney health, and detoxification. It grows well in sandy loam soil with full sun.
Shankhpushpi is an herb valued for its ability to enhance brain health, improve memory, and relieve stress. It thrives in loamy soil with partial shade and requires regular watering.
Vasaka is a medicinal shrub used for its benefits in treating respiratory issues, providing cough relief, and managing bronchitis. It grows well in loamy soil with full sun.
Gokshura is a herb known for its benefits in promoting kidney health, urinary health, and reproductive health. It grows well in sandy loam soil with full sun exposure.
Brahmi is an herb revered for its brain health benefits, particularly in enhancing memory and relieving anxiety. It thrives in wet, marshy soil with partial sun.
Punarnava is an herb known for its diuretic properties and benefits to kidney and liver health. It grows well in loamy soil with full sun exposure.
Chirata is a bitter herb used traditionally for fever relief, detoxification, and improving liver health. It grows well in sandy loam soil with full sun exposure.
Ashwagandha, also known as Winter Cherry, is an adaptogen used for stress relief, boosting immunity, and enhancing energy. It thrives in sandy soil with full sun exposure.
Aloe Vera is a succulent plant known for its soothing properties for skin care, promoting digestive health, and detoxifying the body. It thrives in well-drained sandy soil with full sun exposure.
Giloy is a climber plant recognized for its immune-boosting, fever-relieving, and detoxifying properties. It grows well in loamy soil with partial shade.
Arjuna is a tree widely known for its benefits to heart health, cardiovascular health, and managing blood pressure. It grows well in loamy soil with full sun exposure.

Kalonji, also known as Black Cumin, is a flowering plant used for its digestive health benefits, boosting immunity, and anti-inflammatory properties. It grows well in loamy soil with full sun exposure.
Guduchi is known for its strong immune-boosting properties, fever relief, and detoxification benefits. It grows best in well-drained soil with partial shade.
Haritaki is renowned for its digestive health benefits, detoxification, and anti-aging properties. It thrives in dry, sandy soil with full sun exposure.
Kalmegh is known for its liver health benefits, cold relief, and immune support. It grows well in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Kalonji, or Nigella, is valued for its digestive health benefits, immune boosting properties, and anti-inflammatory effects. It grows well in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Psyllium, also known as Isabgol, is used for its benefits in digestive health, constipation relief, and cholesterol management. It grows best in sandy soil with full sun exposure.
Sarpagandha is known for its ability to regulate blood pressure, relieve anxiety, and treat insomnia. It thrives in well-drained soil with partial shade.
Jatamansi, or Spikenard, is valued for its stress relief, sleep aid, and anti-anxiety properties. It grows well in cool, well-drained soil with partial shade.
Amla, or Indian Gooseberry, is renowned for boosting immunity, its anti-aging benefits, and improving digestive health. It grows well in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
Bhringraj, or False Daisy, is famous for promoting hair health, liver detoxification, and skin care. It grows well in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
